full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 755 Filed 08/10/22 Page 182 of 262 1893 LC8VMAX6 Rodgers - cross 1 Q. And she was the one who arranged for a driver to pick you up at the airport? 2 A. No, we had our own. We would take care of our own transportation, for the pilots we did. 3 Q. I see. Okay. 4 And by that point in the 2000s, you and Mr. Visoski had cell phones, right? Had cell phones at that point, not beepers? 5 A. Yes. 6 Q. So you were communicating about flights usually through your cell phones, right? 7 A. Yes. 8 THE COURT: I'm going to ask again everybody, please, you're talking on top of each other a little bit. It's challenging for the court reporter. So question finishes, then answer; answer finishes, then question. Thank you. 9 MR. EVERDELL: I will be mindful, your Honor. Thank you. 10 Q. So you recall that you had Sarah Kellen's cell phone number in your own phone, right? 11 A. Yes. 12 Q. So you spoke to her often enough to have that programmed in your phone, right? 13 A. Yes. 14 Q. Okay. You don't happen to remember her phone number off 15 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00013460

Okay. 4 And by that point in the 2000s, you and Mr. Visoski had cell phones, right? Had cell phones at that point, not beepers? 5 A. Yes. 6 Q.
